text: one of the biggest misconceptions I see
people walking around with is this idea
that you need to work your butt off in
order to become successful especially
when it comes down to making a lot of
money and I think a large reason for
this is due to the fact that we have so
many motivational speakers telling us
that this is the case take for example
Gary Vaynerchuk
who don't get me wrong is someone that I
deeply respect but he loves to talk
about the fact that he didn't party or
go out at all during his 20s instead he
grinded his ass off every single day
non-stop for over a decade and built the
empire that he has now I'm here to tell
you that you don't have to work as hard
as Gary or nearly as hard as Gary in
fact chances are working that hard will
actually do more harm than good the
truth of the matter is that this sort of
work ethic is unsustainable anyone who
does creative work or does competitive
sports for a living can attest to this
when we work our body or our mind we
undergo stress and stress is good
because it stimulates growth that's how
we get better stronger and faster but
whenever you undergo stress you need to
take time off in order to recover if you
don't give yourself enough time to
recover
that's when stress starts to take a toll
according to peak performance which is a
book that dives into how certain people
get to the top of their fields the top
performing athletes in the world are not
the ones who workout and train at a
hundred percent every time they go to
the gym in fact their training regimen
looks a whole lot more like this they
train at a hundred percent going above
and beyond for two to three gym days
then they reduce the intensity and train
it anywhere from twenty to fifty percent
for another one to two gym days and then
they rest for the remainder of the days
they know how to train hard but they
also know how to let their body rest and
recover when asked why they do this
they'll tell you that this is actually
the most optimal way to improve this
mentality of working hard and resting
hard also relates to making money or
growing a business there's so many
people out there that assume you need to
work your butt off every single day to
build a successful business and that's
far from the truth I should know because
I have a fairly successful online
business and to be honest I work far
less than most people that I know but I
make just as much if not a bit more
money than they do you might be thinking
well improvement pill that's because you
already have
a large audience of course you don't
have to work as much but the truth of
the matter is that this also applied
earlier on in my career when the channel
was just getting started the most I ever
did was two videos a week each video on
average takes me about ten hours to do
so most I was working about 20 to 25
hours a week on the channel sure I could
have done more and trust me I've tried
but I found myself burning out and
losing motivation quite often it was
simply too much stress and in all
honesty making more videos per week
wouldn't have help the channel grow as
much as you think it would the
interesting thing about business is the
fact that it's strikingly similar to war
that's why there's so many business
people who like to read the art of war
an ancient book written by a very famous
Chinese general Sun Tzu sunsoo preaches
about how it's not the amount of men you
have in your army it's about how you
strategize and plan your moves
you could easily defeat an opponent with
ten times your army size if you simply
outplay him and the same thing applies
to business you could easily make more
than someone who works ten times as hard
as you if you carefully plan out how
you're going to work it's all about
working smart not hard so how exactly do
you work smart well the first thing you
need to do is to make sure that you are
actively consuming information related
to your business or your craft look at
other people's experience how they found
success and learn from them read books
articles and case studies so you can
stay updated on different strategies
that worked once you consume this
information you will have the tools
needed to work smart available in the
back of your mind the second thing you
have to do is to allow your mind to
process this information when it came
down to growing my channel and my other
business ventures all my greatest and
most successful ideas that either
significantly grew the channel or
significantly increase the amount of
money I was making came to me days weeks
and even months after I consumed the
information and funny enough it was
almost always in an environment where I
was relaxing whether it be at some sauna
or on the beach or even nights out at a
karaoke bar see when you're working and
under stress your brain isn't focused on
being creative or thinking it's focused
on working it's focused on surviving in
order to work smart and make the right
moves you must give yourself enough time
off from work to relax and think let's
talk about Gary Vee again he spent many
years building up his video series on
wine nowadays Wine Library
is a well-known brand in the wine world
but if you look at the videos he made
over the course of 10 years it's
basically the same exact thing in every
single video he didn't allow himself to
relax and think about what he could do
differently yes he worked really really
hard and it worked but if he worked
smart it's without a doubt that he could
have built his wine channel to its
current size in half the time with half
the effort now I want to make sure you
guys aren't taking this the wrong way I
don't mean to say that you should relax
more than you work there is a balance
that you need to maintain and here's an
example of what I mean whenever I have a
new business idea that I think can make
me more passive income the first thing
I'll do is to lay out all the steps I
need to take in order to set this up
once I plan it all out I give myself a
deadline then I start to put it into
work now when I work on something that I
know needs to be done I work very hard
at it until it's done so oftentimes I'll
work really really hard for two to three
days to get out a new video or to set up
a new project but once I'm done I go
back to relaxing and allow myself the
thing I look at the results of my
project what's working what isn't
working what could I have improved on
these are all good questions that you
should constantly be asking yourself if
you want to work smart if you can strike
this balance properly you'll be able to
pursue your dreams without getting
overwhelmed with stress and burning out
so remember it's not just about how hard
you work that's only a part of the
picture it's about working hard
relaxing hard and also taking time to
carefully think about what you want to
do taking the time to see what you
should change what you should improve on
if you can strike the right balance you
won't burn out and you'll be able to
continue working towards your goals for
a long long period of time this episode

take time off from working and relax but
this doesn't mean that you should ignore
your personal hygiene
